questions.question: Which of these items is ordered correctly, smallest to largest?
How many bits in 1 kibibit?
Which of these items is a biometric security method?
Which of these items is an advantage of a teleconference?
options: Can hear how something is said
questions.correct_answer: Can hear how something is said

questions.question: Which of these items is not a function of an operating system?
options: Checking memory before the device boots
Handling what has been typed in on a keyboard
questions.correct_answer: Checking memory before the device boots

questions.question: Which of these items are examples of whistle blowing?
options: Informing a manager that the backup of the computer system has not completed to schedule
Sharing your password to the computer system with a colleague
Talking about something that happened at work with family at home
Telling a manager about an employee’s serious breach of health and safety procedures
questions.correct_answer: Telling a manager about an employee’s serious breach of health and safety procedures

questions.question: Which device is needed to connect a computer to an ADSL line?
Which of these is not a characteristic of a token ring network?
options: Device must seize token to communicate
Every device on network inspects the token
Token moves between devices in a random order
Token moves one way around the ring
questions.correct_answer: Token moves between devices in a random order

questions.question: Which protocol is used to transfer email from server to server?
Convert 66 in decimal to 8 bit binary.
Convert 100 in decimal to hexadecimal.
Which of these does not need configuring to allow a device to communicate on the Internet?
Which of these is not a wireless technology?
Which of these communication methods would be most appropriate for tendering your resignation?
Which of the following best describes the purpose of a processor component in a computer?
options: To control user access to the data on the computer.
To manage the main functions and operations of the computer.
To store data in the computer.
questions.correct_answer: To manage the main functions and operations of the computer.

questions.question: How do quantum computer systems differ from traditional computer systems?
options: Quantum computers do not rely on binary logic.
Quantum computers do not require secondary storage.
Quantum computers use Open Source Operating Systems.
Quantum computers utilise anti-static to minimise energy consumption.
questions.correct_answer: Quantum computers do not rely on binary logic.

questions.question: Which of the following should be considered when setting up a microwave network?
options: All devices on the network must be in line of sight.
Microwaves can only be transmitted using a digital format.
Microwave nodes should not be set up in areas of dense population.
Microwave signals are not effective beyond a range of 1800 metres.
questions.correct_answer: All devices on the network must be in line of sight.

questions.question: How many bits are included in a nibble?
Which of the following may be a disadvantage to a business of using Open Source software?
options: Competitors may be using the same software.
It may include lots of features.
There may be an increased security risk as the source code can be edited by others.
The business is not tied into one vendor’s system.
questions.correct_answer: There may be an increased security risk as the source code can be edited by others.

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of a multiprocessor operating system?
options: Every task is performed by the same processor.
Multiprocessor systems are easier to design.
Failure in one processor will result in complete system failure.
The throughput of data is usually greater than a single processor system.
questions.correct_answer: The throughput of data is usually greater than a single processor system.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most likely cause of a slow running application on a computer?
Which of the following services is not provided by the User Data Protocol (UDP)?
options: Checksum capability to check on package delivery.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a physical method of improving the security of information?
options: Defragmenting the main server hard drive.

questions.question: Which of the following attempts to gain information does not use social engineering?
options: “Hi, I am new and don’t understand how to access the portal, Andrea says I need a token code but I don’t know what this is.”
“Hi, I am not at work at the moment, but have been locked out of my machine. Could you reset my password please so I can complete this report for the boss?”
“The boss has asked for this information. Do you really want to upset her?”
“What is the security code needed to access the Web Server?”
questions.correct_answer: “What is the security code needed to access the Web Server?”

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using RFID technology rather than a barcode to track packages?
options: Packages do not need to be in line of sight of the reader to be identified.
RFID tags do not need a source of power.
RFID technology does not need specialist equipment to identify packages.
Metal interferes with the RFID signals.
questions.correct_answer: Packages do not need to be in line of sight of the reader to be identified.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes one reason why privacy screens are attached to monitors?
options: To comply with the Copyright, Design and Patents Act 1988.
To improve the working conditions of staff.
To protect data and information from being seen by unauthorised viewers.
To reduce glare on the screens.
questions.correct_answer: To protect data and information from being seen by unauthorised viewers.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes how overwriting old data protects it from being accessed?
options: All data held on the hard disc is deleted.
The data held in each bit on the hard disc is replaced with fresh data.
The data is encrypted so that it cannot be accessed.
The file names are changed so that the data cannot be found.
questions.correct_answer: The data held in each bit on the hard disc is replaced with fresh data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a weakness of using a firewall to protect a website?
options: Does not prevent an authorised user from using the system maliciously.
The firewall restricts access only to those who have previously been on the website.
The firewall will only allow data to flow from the viewer’s machine to the website.
The firewall will only allow data to flow from the website to the viewer’s machine.
questions.correct_answer: Does not prevent an authorised user from using the system maliciously.

questions.question: Which of the following is an input device?
Which of the following is safe to remove whilst a laptop is running?
Which of the following is an example of a port?
Which of the following connection technologies requires line of sight?
Which of the following is not part of the Internet of Things?
Which of the following is an example of an engine management system in a car?
Which of the following is part of an Integrated Design Environment (IDE) that converts instructions into machine code?
Which of the following best describes a personal computer (PC) used at home?
Which communication method would be most appropriate for discussing a new plane design?
Which of the following is not a feature of an Internet Protocol (IP)?
options: Putting packets back together in order.

questions.question: Complete the following sentence: _________ virtualisation typically uses a mixture of private and public cloud services.
Which of the following is an element of a Class C network that will default to 255.255.255.0?
Complete the following sentence: A token ring network is an example of a ______________ .
Which of the following is not a characteristic of an ADSL connection?
Which of the following is not a common characteristic of helpdesk software?
Which of the following is a limitation of desktop computers?
options: Desktop computers do not require a battery.
Desktop computers have large screens compared to other similar devices.
Desktop computers have smaller physical storage than other similar devices.
Desktop computers take up a larger physical space than similar devices.
questions.correct_answer: Desktop computers take up a larger physical space than similar devices.

questions.question: James has to send a photograph from his mobile phone to his brother’s mobile phone. Which of the following best justifies the use of Bluetooth® technology for this purpose?
options: An ad hoc network can be established between the two devices.
Bluetooth® connections work over a long range.
The data transferred will be checked for viruses automatically.
questions.correct_answer: An ad hoc network can be established between the two devices.

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason why a publishing house may decide not to share the source code for the software it publishes?
options: To allow users to use the software on multiple devices.
To allow users to use the software on multiple platforms.
To improve the quality of future software upgrades.
To make the software more difficult to copy.
questions.correct_answer: To make the software more difficult to copy.

questions.question: RK Manufacturing uses CAD/CAM software as part of its manufacturing process. Which of the following is a reason why RK Manufacturing uses CAD/CAM software?
options: CAM software includes templates that can help the design process.
The completed products are more accurate than those produced by human control.
The costs of manufacturing are shared amongst many different organisations.
The range of physical tools available for the machines is wider.
questions.correct_answer: The completed products are more accurate than those produced by human control.

questions.question: Which of the following is a feature of an off-the-shelf operating system?
options: Advanced users may see the source code.
It is made to the user requirements.
It automatically provides regular security updates.
questions.correct_answer: It automatically provides regular security updates.

questions.question: ATAT Printing has travelling engineers who carry out support visits at customer sites. Which of the following communication methods is best suited for use by an engineer wanting to communicate privately with the main office, in real time?
Which of the following is a purpose of Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)?
options: To collect information from network devices
To manage data packet transfer across a network
To manage the transfer of data across the World Wide Web
To provide checksums for data integrity
questions.correct_answer: To collect information from network devices

questions.question: ATAT Printing uses software so that staff can access a simulation of their office desktop whilst working away from the office. This is an example of which of the following?
What is the purpose of an IP address?
options: To identify the operating system on the computer
To restrict the number of clients who can connect to the host server
To split the network into subnetworks

questions.question: Colin has to gather data on the IT Support team’s performance over the past year and pass this information to his manager. Which would be the most appropriate method of communication?

Maisie is setting up a meeting for a large group of people. During the meeting, she has to deliver a lot of information as quickly and as clearly as possible. Which of the following is the most suitable type of software to use for this purpose?
Rebecca has received a suspicious email from someone pretending to be from her bank. What sort of threat is this?
Which of the following is a physical security method?

Which wireless technology requires ‘pairing’?

Which business software is most suitable for creating a safety poster?
Which communication software enables several users to participate in a meeting over the phone?

Which of the following methods allows participants to use body language to aid communication?
Which of the following does not demonstrate readiness to work through appearance?

Which physical security method requires the user to have a key or a code?
Which digital security method enables the system administrator to allow users access to different data or software on a system?

Which of the following devices converts digital data to analogue data?
Which of the following units of multiple bytes is equal to 1015 bytes?
A game magazine provides a link to download a new game which is initially provided as free, but has a built-in expiration date. This is an example of what kind of software?

Which of the below features in the Application layer of the TCP/IP protocol stack?
A permanent point-to-point link creating a pre-established WAN connection is called:
In a remote area with no network coverage, which of the following connectivity methods would be most suitable to make a voice call?

An online shop selling lycra cycle clothing directs you to the payment page, but you notice that the URL does not begin with HTTPS. You do not enter your bank details. This is an example of:
A user clicks on an application that they think is safe, but it actually opens a ‘backdoor’ to their computer. This is an example of:
Which of the following is the most effective way to prevent intercepted emails from being read?
Which of the following is a characteristic of an embedded computer system?
options: Able to carry out a wide range of tasks
Can be upgraded by a user

questions.question: Which hardware is needed to connect a tablet computer to the internet?

Identify the personal attribute required to be a network manager.

Which of the following is not a purpose of a professional body?
Which operational issue would be implemented if a flood affected a business’s computer systems?
Which of the following is not a feature of providing remote access for a business’s employees?
options: Only accessible through one type of device
questions.correct_answer: Only accessible through one type of device

questions.question: Which digital security method can be linked to user groups when protecting a computer system?
